definitions.definition: The state of being a ward of someone.
In English feudal law, the guardianship which the lord had of the land of his vassal while the latter was an infant or minor.

main_definition: ( chiefly law ) The state of being a ward of someone.
secondary_definitions: ( historical ) In English feudal law, the guardianship which the lord had of the land of his vassal while the latter was an infant or minor.
